--- exname: mariokart-korr2 extype: num exsolution: r sol exshuffle: no extol: 0.05 expoints: 1 categories: - datawrangling - dplyr - eda - association - num date: '2023-05-08' slug: mariokart-korr2 title: mariokart-korr2 --- # Aufgabe Importieren Sie den Datensatz `mariokart` in R. Filtern Sie die *neuen* Spiele. Berechnen Sie die Korrelation von Verkaufspreis (`total_pr`) und Startgebot (`start_pr`)! Hinweise: - Runden Sie auf 2 Dezimalstellen.









# Lösung Pakete starten: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) library(easystats) ``` ::: Daten importieren: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} d_url <- "https://vincentarelbundock.github.io/Rdatasets/csv/openintro/mariokart.csv" d <- data_read(d_url) ``` ::: Oder so: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} data(mariokart, package = "openintro") ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} solution <- d %>% filter(cond == "new") %>% summarise(pr_cor = cor(total_pr, start_pr)) solution ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
| pr_cor| |--------:| | 0.405102|
::: ::: Alternativ kann man (komfortabel) die Korrelation z.B. so berechnen: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} d %>% select(start_pr, total_pr, cond) %>% filter(cond == "new") %>% correlation() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|Parameter1 |Parameter2 | r| CI| CI_low| CI_high| t| df_error| p|Method | n_Obs| |:----------|:----------|--------:|----:|---------:|---------:|--------:|--------:|--------:|:-------------------|-----:| |start_pr |total_pr | 0.405102| 0.95| 0.1662683| 0.5990402| 3.345235| 57| 0.001459|Pearson correlation | 59|
::: ::: ::: {.cell} ::: **Lösung:** 0.41. --- Categories: - datawrangling - dplyr - eda - association - num
